lead_paragraph: In New York City, more than 1,000 people are expected to die from drug overdoses in 2016 — the first recorded four-digit death total in city history, according to statistics compiled by the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene. Nearly half of all unintentional drug overdose deaths in the city since July have involved fentanyl, the health department said.

headline.main: Record Overdoses Expected in New York City
